SE450: Using Command Line Tools: Windows: Textpad/Java/Ant/Junit [8/16]

  • In each of the following, replace ??? with the correct suffix for whatever version you get.
  • Download TextPad.
    • Follow the instructions.
  • Download Java SE
    • You want the JDK (not just the JRE). The JDK includes the JRE and also the compiler and other tools.
    • Follow the instructions.
    • After installation, make sure you have a directory named C:\Program Files\Java\jdk???, where the question marks are some version number.
  • Download Ant
    • create directory C:\local
    • unzip to C:\local
    • rename C:\local\apache-ant??? to C:\local\apache-ant
    • edit PATH variable; add C:\local\apache-ant\bin
    • create JAVA_HOME variable; value C:\Program Files\Java\jdk???
  • Download Junit
    • unzip to C:\local
    • rename C:\local\junit??? to C:\local\junit
    • rename C:\local\junit\junit???.jar to C:\local\junit\junit.jar
    • create CLASSPATH variable; value .;C:\local\junit\junit.jar
  • To run ant/junit:
    • create a directory (say C:\Documents and Settings\me\My Documents\hw-01)
    • Unzip the files for homework one into the hw-01 directory.
    • Start a shell prompt: go to the start menu and select "run". In the dialog box type cmd and enter.
    • At the shell prompt move to the correct directory (type cd C:\Documents and Settings\me\My Documents\hw-01)
    • At the shell prompt, run ant (enter ant).
    • You can run ant by entering ant -find in any subdirectory of C:\Documents and Settings\me\My Documents\hw-01.
  • See a few slides ahead for advice on integrating ant into textpad.
